info.descko: 사춘기 아이 때문에 고민하는 그녀에게 남자가 해준 조언은?
info.descen: How about baking a birthday cake for her?

sentense.en: Hi, how’s it going? I haven’t seen Derek for a while. Is he okay?
sentense.en_: Hi, how’s it going? I haven’t seen Derek for a while. Is he okay?
sentense.ko: 안녕, 어떻게 지내니? 한 동안 Derek을 보지 못했어. 그는 잘 지내니?

sentense.en: Yeah..., he seems okay, but he doesn’t talk with me like he used to.
sentense.en_: Yeah..., he seems okay, but he doesn’t talk with me like he used to.
sentense.ko: 응.... 괜찮은 것 같아, 하지만 그가 예전 같이 나와 함께 이야기를 하지는 않아.

sentense.en: Well, that’s a sign of growing up.
sentense.en_: Well, that’s a sign of growing up.
sentense.ko: 그럼, 그것은 그가 성장하고 있다는 신호네.

sentense.en: That’s true, but my concern is that he only stays in his room after he comes home.
sentense.en_: That’s true, but my concern is that he only stays in his room after he comes home.
sentense.ko: 맞아, 하지만 내 걱정은 그가 집에 돌아와서는 그저 자기 방에만 있다는 거야.

sentense.en: Does he hang out with his friends?
sentense.en_: Does he hang out with his friends?

sentense.en: Not very often, these days. Hmm, maybe once every other week.
sentense.en_: Not very often, these days. Hmm, maybe once every other week.
sentense.ko: 요즘은 아주 종종 그렇지는 않아. 흠, 아마도 2주에 한 번 정도.

sentense.en: Teenagers are supposed to experience emotional ups and downs.
sentense.en_: Teenagers are supposed to experience emotional ups and downs.
sentense.ko: 십대의 아이들은 감정의 기복을 겪게 되어 있잖아.

sentense.en: Is there anything I can do for him, though?
sentense.en_: Is there anything I can do for him, though?
sentense.ko: 하지만 내가 그를 위해 할 수 있는 게 있니?

sentense.en: I’m not an expert, but just let him know that you are there for him if he needs you.
sentense.en_: I’m not an expert, but just let him know that you are there for him if he needs you.
sentense.ko: 내가 전문가는 아니잖아, 하지만 그에게 네가 필요하다면 넌 그를 위해 함께 있다는 것을 그에게 알게 해 줘.

sentense.en: I’m afraid that he might be getting worse.
sentense.en_: I’m afraid that he might be getting worse.
sentense.ko: 난 그가 좀 더 악화될까봐 걱정돼.
